With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old, a woman, and married. She has two children aged 13 and 4 years respectively, who she supports.

Jane was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer and she has run a cereal business for one and a half year now. In her business she earns a monthly income of KSH 12,800. 

She is taking her first loan of KSH 30,000, which she intends to use to add stock to her business, including rice, beans, green grams, sugar, maizeflour, wheatflour, cowpeas and cooking oil.

Jane will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and her family is to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereal items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her purchase more ingredients for her snacks for resale.

loans.name: Manyak

texts.en:
Manyak is 55 years old and she lives in the village Lchashen in Gegharkunik region. She is married and she is a mother of two very pretty and very clever girls. Both of them are already students of Yerevan State University at the International Economics department. 

Manyak has graduated pedagogical college and since her graduation in 2000, she has worked at the kindergarten. Over the last ten years, she has been running her own business and helps her husband to earn a family living. She has her own small shop, where she sells household products, clothes, stationary and a great variety of foods. Her shop is very popular in their village, as she is very skilled in trading business and she does her best to attract more customers. 

She needs a loan in an amount of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to add to her shop’s stock before Christmas and New Year’s holidays.

loans.use: to add her shop’s stock before Christmas and New Year’s holidays

loans.name: Jesca's Group

texts.en:
Jesca’s group has 7 group leader farmers and is located in Chwele District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 71 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of KSH 5,349 to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, Jesca is pictured on the right of the group with her hand raised.	

Jesca is married and has 5 children. She is 40 years old and is known as friendly and an experienced farmer. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group. Jesca has been a farmer for 12 years. Jesca described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  				

The 2013 long rains season won’t be Jesca’s first season with One Acre Fund. She first joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. As an active member in her community, Jesca also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative. Jesca plans on using future profits from the harvest to buy a cow and invest in a business. Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has been able to save money and feed the family. Jesca also joined One Acre Fund because of early planting.  							
							
Jesca and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of soya beans and porridge ingredients, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her purchase large quantities of watermelon for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of second hand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of her provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amount of maize and other ingredients, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a member of Central Group in Kakamega North District. She is pictured here in a group of 10 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 92 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Agnes has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KSH 5,349 for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							
Agnes is 54 years old and has been a farmer for 23 years. Agnes works as a farmer to provide for her 2 children. The community and other farmers know Agnes as reliable and trustworthy. Other than farming, she is also involved in community groups such as the women's group and prayer group.  Agnes described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Agnes joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the long rains 2014 season as a group leader. Agnes joined One Acre Fund so that she could get new farming methods. Because she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Agnes has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Agnes's life because she has more profit from harvest and is able to save money. In the future, Agnes hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to buy a cow.  

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Agnes and the Central Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Everline's Group

texts.en:
Everline is a member of this group in Chwele District. She is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 62 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Everline has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KSH 5,349 for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							
Everline is not married and has one child. She is 40 years old and is known as friendly and hardworking. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group. Everline has been a farmer for 20 years. Everline described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund because she wants eradicate poverty.  		

Everline first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season. Everline joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed her family. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to help more farmers. Everline plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to buy a cow, and invest in a business. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Everline’s own life was improved because she was able to save money, feed her family and pay fees. 		
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Everline and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.		

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 35 years old. She is a woman, married and supports five children aged 14,12,10, 8 and 5 years respectively. 

Margaret was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET staff member, and she is a taking her third loan from KADET of KSH 20,000. She runs a café  business which has lasted three years now and earns a monthly income of  KSH 4,200. She will use the loan to increase stock in her business, including wheat flour, maize flour, oil, sugar, salt as well as utensils. She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand her cafe. 

Her hopes and dreams for her future business is to expand her business by making it into a hotel and to make sure her children get an education.

loans.use: To buy wheatflour, maizeflour, oil, sugar, salt to make food for her customers.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 5 group leader farmers in Chwele District with Joyce selected as the Kiva representative. Joyce has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 59 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of KSH 5,349.							
Joyce is a reliable member of the community. She is married with 4 children. Joyce is 45 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 24 years to support her family. In addition to this, Joyce is very active in her community and is involved in the prayer group. She described her harvest last year as good. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							
Joyce joined One Acre Fund in 2009, and is now enrolling in the long rains 2014 season as a group leader. Joyce joined One Acre Fund so that she could get new farming methods. Because she wants to help more farmers, Joyce has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Joyce's life because she is able to feed the family. In the future, Joyce hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to buy a cow.  			

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Joyce and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.		

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Faulu is a group of 5 group leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Violet selected as the Kiva representative. Violet has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 51 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of KSH 5,349.	

Violet is 32 years old and has been a farmer for 6 years. Violet works as a farmer to provide for her 3 children. The community and other farmers know Violet as friendly. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community, in groups such as the women's group and prayer group. Violet described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Violet first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season. Violet joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member. Violet plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to save for the future. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Violet’s own life was improved because she was able to feed the family. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Violet and the Faulu Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to have the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Shagali Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chantal est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaire «Shagali », entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 35 ans, et mère de 9 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse d’habits (pagnes). Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint est un technicien mécanicien. Plus tard, elle bénéficia son premier prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 3 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 15 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroître son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son projet d’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs, en leur accordant des microcrédits sans garantie matérielle surtout; pendant, ce moment critique des conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Chantal is a shopkeeper and a member of the borrowing group "Shagali," as well as an experienced entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has 9 children, all of whom attend school. Chantal sells clothing (the "pagne" cloth traditional in western Africa.) She sells her products at the market in the city.

Chantal began her business with the help of her husband, who is a mechanical technician. Later, Chantal received her first loan from the microfinance organization Hekima. She has been in business for 3 years. This new loan will allow her to purchase 15 pieces of "pagne" cloth. She hopes to use this to grow her business, and to educate and feed her children. In closing, she sincerely thanks Hekima for their support of self-sufficiency of women entrepreneurs, by granting them microloans without requiring collateral, especially during this critical time of conflict in the region.

loans.use: to purchase 15 pieces of "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Adrian Marie

texts.en:
Adrian Marie is 19 years old, happily single and a resident of Plaridel-Danao, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living through fishing. Through her teenage years, she has become a responsible person who helps her family.

She became a member of PMPC in the year 2013 and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Adrian Marie deeply wishes to maintain a membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is from Plaridel-Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old and is a widow with five children. In 2002, Feliciana applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Feliciana is asking for financial assistance of 7,000 PHP to buy additional heads of pigs to raise. Through this, she hopes to increase her income more and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional heads of pigs.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn is 40 years of age and a resident of Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is happily married with ten children. This is their way of sustaining their day-to-day needs. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more fish to sell. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help should there be a need for working capital in the future. Rosalyn smiles at the thought of seeing her children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is 47 years old and lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to help the family, she operates a sari-sari store. From her sari-sari store business, she wants to invest in a bakery of her own. In 2012, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of 50,000 PHP to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store and future bakery business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in his local community to earn a living. He has been doing this for more than six years and earns well for the family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan from GDMPC that he used to repair his vehicle. Now, Ronald would like to borrow a new loan to purchase tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en: Eustaquia sells magazines and foods like 'tagactac, a local delicacy and a specialty of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She has been selling food in the bus terminal to earn a living and she earns well to provide for her needs. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC which she had used for her business. She is taking a loan to buy additional snacks to vend. Eustaquia plans to save a portion of her profit to prepare for future needs.

loans.use: to buy additional snacks to vend.

loans.name: Javid

texts.en: Javid is a 29-year-old man. He is married and has two children. For the past nine years he has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable business. It is the main source of income for the family, but he also needs more support to cover the costs from time to time. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN from VFAC to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary spare parts for the car. This will increase the capacity to work extra hours and enable Javid to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives in the North-Rift Highlands of Litein where he does farming. He is married and has four children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has been farming for the past five years and produces and sells milk, tea and eggs. He enjoys tea farming as he has a large piece of land where he has planted tea and it is very profitable, especially when he exports the tea. His biggest challenge is unpredictable climates because tea requires continuous water for it to do well.

Jonathan chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they have a lower interest rate on their loans and they process the loans faster. During the training he received on MFIs, he learnt that they help small income earners to acquire assets easily and grow economically. Through this loan he will purchase a dairy cow which will boost his income and enable him to purchase more income-generating assets which will improve living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita operates her own general store to make a living. She earns well from her business and she is able to provide her family. She is taking a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She is determined to expand and improve her business in order to have a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2000 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and is very active in attending the various programs and services that the cooperative offers. 

Lilia is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 18,000 to buy more coco shells for making charcoal. This loan is intended to increase her inventories.

Lilia dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and to receive an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase more coco shells for making charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is an 18-year-old single man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a small house in the city. His father works as an employee in a local firm where he receives a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Mahmoud is a student in his first year where he studies economics. He loves this specialization. Mahmoud would like to work in a financial firm and help his family pay part of their expenses. 

Mahmoud took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a Ugandan male who is 40 years old and from Nyamiti, a village in the Kibale district. He is married and has nine children between 6 and 20 years old. His main business is a retail shop where he works six days a week.

He has approached Ugafode for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to add stock to his retail shop. He earns additional income from motorcycle transport and the sale of coffee.

He, however, faces challenges of seasonality and weather challenges because they affect his other source of income, which is farming. He dreams of setting up a large wholesale shop in the nearby trading center.

loans.use: To buy retail stock for his general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dajhane Beatriz

texts.es: La Señorita Dajhane tiene 20 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de derecho, trabaja para pagar sus estudios se dedica a la atención de una fotocopiadora, estudia en la universidad Salesiana  de Bolivia, este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución,  la Señorita Dajhane va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar cómo pagar las mensualidades correspondientes a este semestre para terminar sus estudios. que durara el tiempo 4 años, La Señorita Dajhane enfrenta retos en su estudios que son mucha competencia en el campo laboral, vive en la zona  Munaypata, su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es tener un lugar de trabajo estable para poder desempeñarse como profesional.
texts.en:
Dajhane, 20, is single and studying for her law degree.  She works supervising a photocopy machine to pay for her studies at the Universidad Salesiana de Bolivia.  This is her first loan through the institution.

Dajhane will use the loan to cover different expenses such as paying this semester's tuition for her four-year degree.  She is up against challenges in her career such as the significant amount of competition in her field in the area.  She lives in the area of Munaypata and wants to finish her degree so she can get a stable job and work as a professional.

loans.use: To pay tuition and buy text books and supplies.

loans.name: Gregorio Justino

texts.es:
Gregorio es soltero tiene 55 años , tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas de la Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Gregorio trabaja en la agricultura a la siembra de maiz  y la crianza de gallinas y cerdos para luego venderlos.  

Los productos vende en el mercado de Mocache Y San Carlos.

Gregorio le gusta hacer deporte con los amigos del barrio.

El socio solicita el crédito  para la siembra de maíz comprar fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas y balanceados.

Su meta es seguir prosperando en el trabajo para aumentar a la economia de la familia y tener dinero para salir de viaje en avion.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 55 years old and single.  He has three children and lives in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province, in Ecuador.

Gregorio is a member of the "Aso 10 de Septiembre" communal bank in Lechugalito, an area in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province.

Gregorio works in farming - he sows corn and raises hens and pigs that he then sells in the Mocache Y San Carlos market.

Gregorio likes to play sports with his friends from the local area.

He is applying for this loan to sow corn and buy fertilisers, manure, weed-killers and animal feed.

Gregorio's goal is to continue prospering in his work in order to increase his income for the family, and to have enough money to travel on a plane.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, weed-killers and animal feed.

loans.name: Victor Rodrigo

texts.es:
Victor es casado, de 34 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos: 4 varones y 1 mujer, el junto a su familia vive en Sololá. Desde muchos años se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas (cebolla y papa), esa actividad la heredó de sus padres, porque desde niño los ayudaba a cultivar la tierra. La cosecha que obtiene la comercializa en Sololá. Realiza está actividad porque es algo honesto y es el medio por el cual obtiene los ingresos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de 2 cuerdas (0.143 hectáreas) de cebolla para comercializar. 
El sueño más importante de Victor es incrementar su patrimonio comprando más terreno.
texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Victor is married.  He has five children - four boys and one girl - and lives with his family in Sololá.  For many years, Victor has worked growing vegetables (onions and potatoes) having learned the trade from his parents.  Since he was a young boy, Victor has helped his parents work the land.  Victor sells his harvest in Sololá.  He does this work because it is honest and, with it, he earns a living to support his family.

Victor is applying for a loan of 6,000 QetZAl in order to buy two strings of onions (for 0.143 hectares) to sell.

Victor's biggest dream is to increase his assets by buying more land.

loans.use: to buy two strings of onions (for 0.143 hectares) to sell.

loans.name: José Amilcar

texts.es:
José de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida con quien tiene una hija en común. Dentro de la familia es la única persona que tiene actividad económica. La compañera de vida,  es la que desarrolla las actividades del hogar, Su hija está estudiando.

José tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a ser pescador artesanal,  quienes le enseñaron dicha actividad,  fueron familiares que residen en la localidad en que vive. Él decidió vivir de la pesca por tener cerca la costa,  en donde poder comercializar el producto que pesca.

El crédito tendrá como destino la compra de materiales para la elaboración de redes. Como resultado de esta inversión,  él obtendrá  mejores pescas lo que se traducirá en mejores ingresos para poder cubrir sus gastos en el hogar.

Sus aspiraciones a futuro,  son poder tener un equipo de pesca que le permita trabajar sin ningún inconveniente y poder dar a su familia lo necesario para vivir y no pasar ningún tipo de necesidad.
texts.en:
José is 48 years old and lives with his life partner, with whom he has a daughter.  José is the only one in the family who works while his partner looks after the home.  Their daughter is in school.

José has a lot of time to work as an artisan fisherman.  He learned his trade from his relatives who live in the same town as he does.  José decided to earn a living from fishing as lives by the coast, where he is able to sell his products.

This loan will be used to buy materials to make nets.  With this investment José will have better catches, resulting in a higher income to cover household costs.

José's aspirations for the future are to have a team that will allow him to work without any difficulties and to be able to give his family everything they need in order to live.

loans.use: to buy materials for making fishing nets.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been doing this for many years, and she earns enough for their daily needs. 

She also had successfully repaid her previous loan taken from GDMPC that she used to purchase goods to sell.

She took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery items to sell. 

In the future, Sergia wants to build a house, and wants her child to become successful.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Juan Neponucemo

texts.es:
Juan de 66 años de edad,  por las condiciones económicas en las cuales creció, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar; desde muy pequeño se dedicó a trabajar la tierra. No obstante, no tener ningún grado de escolaridad tiene la convicción que sus hijos tienen que ir a la escuela.

Sobre el trato de cultivos tanto de maíz como de maicillo, posee la suficiente experiencia para sacar el mejor de los
Provechos al momento de comercializar los granos. En los cultivos se involucra toda la familia. Los terrenos donde se cultivan están cerca de su casa. 

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos y pesticidas). Con ello lograra un máximo rendimiento en su cosecha y al final obtendrá las ganancias esperadas en base a su esfuerzo. También,  parte del crédito será para mejorar la vivienda.

             Como padre de familia sus aspiraciones son que sus hijos se preparen, y estudien para no depender solo de los trabajos agrícolas que son tan pesados. También,  desea que tengan una vivienda que reúna las condiciones básicas de salubridad y seguridad.
.
texts.en:
Juan, 66, was unable to get an education because of the economic conditions surrounding his youth.  From a very early age he had to work in farming.  Despite not having an education he believes his children should go to school.

Regarding crops such as corn and sorghum, he has enough experience to get the best prices when selling grain.  The entire family is involved in the crop farming and the cropland is near the home.

The loan will be used to buy farm supplies (fertilizers and pesticides).  With these he will be able to maximize his harvest and earn the profit he hopes to through his hard work.  Part of the loan will also be used to renovate the house.

As the head of household, Juan has high hopes for his children to get an education and not have to depend on hard farm work.  He also wants them to have healthy, safe homes.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies (fertilizers and pesticides) and renovate his house.

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con una hija y una nieta en una aldea del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Lleva muchos años de vender ropa de toda clase, sandalias, zapatos, también elabora y vende achiote, cocos, tiene una mini pulpería donde vende churros, refrescos, pan y dulces. Ya ha solicitado varios prestamos con la institución para sus actividades, actualmente solicita uno por 20,000 Lempiras para surtir su negocio con mercadería de temporada y productos alimenticios como pan, churros, galletas, refrescos, para su pulpería, y aprovechar la temporada. Tiene como plan mejorar los ingresos y tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
María, 61, is a single mother who lives with her daughter and a granddaughter in a village in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.  She has always worked as a merchant.  For several years she sold all kinds of clothing, sandals and shoes, and also made and sold achiote (red spice) and coconuts.  She has a mini-market where she sells pastries, soft drinks, bread and sweets.

María has requested several loan through the institution for her businesses and currently she is requesting 20,000 HNL to buy seasonal goods and food products such as bread, churros (doughnuts), cookies and soft drinks for her store to take advantge of the season.  Her plan is to improve her income and have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seasonal goods for her store.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Leonor to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy shirts, shorts, long pants, long sleeves, and short sleeves.

She is married and has two children; she  opened her second hand store in 2009 with her own working capital. Leonor is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family, and her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy shirts, shorts, long pants, long sleeves and short sleeves

loans.name: William's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven group leader farmers in Chwele District, with William selected as the Kiva representative. William has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 66 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

William is married and has 19 children. He is 58 years old and is known as hardworking. He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group. He has been a farmer for 25 years. William described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

William joined One Acre Fund in 2011. As an active member in his community, he also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member.  William plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he was able to feed the family.							

William and his group needs a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn manages a service-based business providing transportation in her community to make a living.  She has more than nine years in this business, and she earns well for the family. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used to purchase spare parts and accessories. 

To finance the costs of vehicle repairs and maintenance, Marilyn took another loan from GDMPC. 

It is her desire to improve her business to have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to finance the costs of vehicle repairs and maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en:
Gabil is a 28-year-old farmer. He is newly married. Gabil has been farming for eight years, and he produces and sells meat, milk products, and eggs. He enjoys farming because it generates income for him, but his major challenges are poor roads and a lack of good markets.

Through this loan, he will purchase construction materials to finish repair work at home.

This loan will enable him to improve his family's living standards and manage his income.

loans.use: To finish home repairs.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single young man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. His brother works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad is a student in his first year where he studies finance. He loves this specialization. Mohammad would like to work in a financial firm and help his family with part of the family expenses. 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN (Palestine for Credit & Development). This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de agronomía y gracias a ello logro conseguir empleo en una institución de su ciudad; con el fruto de su trabajo ha podido iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa y artículos de vestir, con lo cual puede tener un ingreso extra.

Alberto está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como polos, sandalias, entre otros; así podrá atender los pedidos de sus clientes y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Alberto lives in the city of Pucallpa, it was with a lot of hard work that he managed to pursue a degree in agronomy and thanks to that he managed to obtain a job in an entity in his city. With the fruit of his work, he was able to start selling clothes, with which to have an additional income. 

Alberto is grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that he will be able to buy merchandise for his business such as T-shirts, sandals, and so on. In this manner, he will be able to meet his customer's orders and continue fighting to make his greatest dream a reality: having his own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single young man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. His mother works as an employee in a public firm where she gets a low income, and this is the only source of income for the family.

Mohammad is a student in his first year where he studies law. He loves this specialization. Mohammad would like to work as a lawyer and help his family with part of the family expenses.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.en:
Akmaljon was born in the year 1996. He is a smart and kind young person.

Akmaljon graduated school with good and excellent marks. He entered the Tajikistan National University where Akmaljon studies at the Agriculture faculty. He is one of the successful students. Akmaljon is going to work in an agricultural structure after graduating university. He is not married and lives with his parents.

He must pay for tuition at the university and, with this aim, he is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Dioselina De Jesús

texts.es:
Dioselina, a sus 58 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y cabeza de hogar. Durante su vida productiva trabajó como enfermera en diferentes clínicas y hospitales de la ciudad pero debido a un accidente que sufrió, quedó con secuelas irreparables dejándola con problemas físicos; razón por la que se dedica a elaborar y vender bufandas tejidas por ella, además de vender productos por catálogo con el fin de generar los recursos económicos suficientes para sustentar las necesidades de su familia. Cuenta con la ventaja de manejar su propio tiempo, lo que le permite tener mayor independencia para estar al cuidado de sus hijos, mientras realiza sus labores.
El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de materia prima y surtido  al por mayor (lana, accesorios, perfumería, cremas corporales, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse para la temporada de fin de año en la que la demanda de sus productos se incrementa, generándole mayor nivel de utilidades que le ayudarán a mejorar su calidad de vida.  
Dioselina manifiesta que su principal meta es poder montar su negocio en un local comercial, que esté ubicado en un sector muy transitado para mejorar sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe; con lo que podrá seguir apoyando económicamente a sus hijos y disfrutar junto a ellos un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
At 58 years of age, Dioselina is a mother to two children and head of the household. Throughout her working life, she has worked as a nurse in different clinics and hospitals in the city but due to an accident she had, she was left with irreparable injuries which left her with physical problems, hence why she makes her living making and selling scarves which she made, as well as selling catalog products with which to generate enough financial resources to support her family's needs. She benefits from the advantage of managing her own time, which allows her to have more independence to care for her children while carrying out her work.

Dioselina wants to invest the loan in the purchase of basic goods and bulk goods (wool, accessories, perfume, body cream and so on); this way she will be able to stock up for the end-of-year season in which demand for her products increases, generating a higher level of profits that will help her improve her quality of life.  
  
Dioselina says that her main aim is to set up her business in a commercial store, located in an area  that is highly frequented to improve her sales and the income that she makes; with these sales, she will be able to continue financially supporting her children and enjoy a good level of health with them.

loans.use: to buy basic items and bulk goods (wool, accessories, perfume, body cream and so on.

loans.name: Julieto

texts.en:
Julieto is married and he manages his own farm to make a living. He grows and harvests coconuts and other crops, selling them in town. He earns well to provide for the family.

He took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase organic fertilizer to have a greener farm. He wants to be able to earn more returns from his farm this season to used for their future needs.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as body lotion, fish, sugar, salt, books and pencils. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, fish, sugar, salt, books and pencils

loans.name: Shafaqat

texts.en: Shafaqat is a 42 -year-old woman, an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with her husband and seven children. She is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 13 years. She chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch. Shafagat sells her crop in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is 250 AZN. Her husband actively helps her to raise crops. As these products are in high demand, Shafagat wants to expand her business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose she applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN. She will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es: Yeni de 42 años de edad es separada  con 01 hijo en etapa escolar, actualmente pertenece al grupo “Virgen De Copacabana”  conformada por 13 socios responsables y emprendedores. Yeni  se dedica a la venta de verduras, la cual lo realiza en un mercado. Con el fin de mejorar su vivienda y ayudar con los gastos del hogar Yeni  inició su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de verduras como papa, cebollas, limones y tomates. Su mayor deseo es de seguir implementando su negocio.  El grupo “Virgen De Copacabana” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Yeni se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho, y viste polo rojo.
texts.en:
Yeni is 42, separated from her husband, and the mother of a school-aged boy. She is currently one of 13 entrepreneurial and trustworthy women who make up of the “Virgen De Copacabana” ["Virgin of Copacabana"] Group. 

Yeni started a business selling vegetables in a market to earn income for home improvements and to meet household expenses. She applied for a loan to purchase vegetables such as potatoes, onions, lemons, and tomatoes. Yeni's primary ambition is to continue building her business. The “Virgen De Copacabana” Group would like to thank the people who made this loan possible. Yeni is the first person seated at right in this photo and is wearing a red shirt.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as potatoes, onions, lemons, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is applying for a loan of $700 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 40 years old.

She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as flour, buckets, oil, sugar and salt. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Filomena is living in a town near by the school, and her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy flour, buckets, oil, sugar and salt

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en: Stellah is 51 years old woman who is married. She has two children, 26 and 21 years old respectively, who she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by Kadet officer. She sells milk and has been in this business for thirteen years. In her business, she earns a monthly income of KES 4,550. She is taking her first loan of KES 10,000, which she intends to use to buy a heifer. Stellah will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family is to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a heifer for the production of milk.

loans.name: Maria Valentina

texts.es:
Doña María Valentina es una micro empresaria, vive  en una comunidad  en el oriente de Honduras, es una mujer muy trabajadora y se dedicada a la venta y crianza de cerdos.
Doña María Valentina está  solicitando el préstamo para compra de más cerdos, para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ya que en esta temporada navideña se le vende mucho este producto.
Doña María Valentina espera que esta inversión le ayude a hacer crecer su negocio y a la vez le permita obtener los ingresos suficientes para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma.


Trojes, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
María Valentina is a microentrepreneur, she lives in a community in the east of Honduras, she is a very hardworking woman and makes her living selling and rearing pigs.

María Valentina is seeking the loan to buy more pigs to satisfy the needs of her customers as in this Christmas period, this product is in demand.

María Valentina hopes that this investment will help her to grow the business and also allow her to have enough income to satisfy her family's needs. She is very happy about working with Prisma.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her business/

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 29 years old and he lives in Ijevan in Tavush region. Karen has his own business; he sells flowers and bouquets made of it and he also has a coffee grinder and he also sells ground coffee. He buys the flowers for bouquets every other day at the local wholesale flower market and he goes there very early in the morning in order to manage to buy nice, fresh and not very expensive flowers. In all ,Karen is not satisfied with his flower sale business’ income, since during these cold months flowers do not sell very much. The main financial income of his family comes from the sale of coffee. Karen is married and he has two small children. Karen’s wife tries to help her husband to earn a living and she works at the local school as a teacher.
Karen is asking for a loan of 500,000 AMD in order to buy a new, more powerful coffee grinder and some new assortment of flowers to sell.

loans.use: to buy a new, more powerful coffee grinder and some new assortments of flowers to sell.

loans.name: Zayron Olmedo

texts.es:
Zayron tiene 40 años, vive en unión libre, y tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos, junto a su familia.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Zayron trabaja en la agricultura  y crianza de gallinas para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, arroz y cacao, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos en la casa los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado de Mocache y en la feria de San Carlos.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar fungicidas, abonos, balanceado y vacunas para evitar enfermedades de los animales.  Su meta es mejorar su situación  económica. 

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte en las canchas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Zayron is 40 years old, he lives in a common-law marriage and has three children. She lives in the canton of Ventanas, the Los Ríos province, together with his family. He is a member of the rural solidarity group Aso. 10 de Septiembre which is located in Lechugalito  it is an area which belongs to the Ventanas canton, the Los Ríos province.  

Zayron works in agriculture and rears chicken to increase his family's finances. The crops that earn the most are corn, rice and cocoa, in addition, he also rears chicken and pigs at home. He sells the products at home and in the Mocache market and the San Carlos festival.

He is seeking the loan to buy fungicides, fertilizers, animal feed and vaccines to prevent his animals from falling ill. His aim is to improve his financial situation. In his spare time, he likes playing sport in the community sports fields.

loans.use: to buy fungicides, fertilizers, animal feed and vaccines to prevent animal illnesses.

loans.name: Linda Lisseth

texts.es: Linda, tiene 32 años de edad, esta soltera, vive con su madre y una hermana, reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella estuvo trabajando como operaria de maquila y al quedar sin empleo decidió establecer su propio negocio donde vende variedad de productos, en su tiendita tiene ropa nueva, sandalias, lociones  y cosméticos. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería nueva como ropa, zapatos, cremas, desodorantes, lociones, maquillajes y otros cosméticos para vender en esta temporada. Su meta es aumentar el inventario para poder aumentar las ventas y los ingresos.
texts.en: Linda, 32, is single, she lives with her mother and a sister, and lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She was working as a machine operator and when she found herself without any work, she decided to set up her own business where she sells a variety of products. In her small store, she has new clothes, sandals, lotions and cosmetics. The loan that she has sought is for 20,000 Honduran Lempiras and she will invest in the purchase of new merchandise such as clothes, shoes, creams, deodorants, make-up and other cosmetics to sell in this season. Her aim is to increase the inventory to grow her sales and her profits.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, shoes, creams, deodorants, lotions, make-up and other cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and bricks.

loans.name: Virginia Feliza

texts.es: La señora Virginia tiene 36 años casada con tres hijos de las edades de 19, 17 y 15, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado como también venta de leche la señora Virginia vive en la localidad de Batallas,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La señora Virginia va a usar este préstamo para compra de ganado lechero para crianza por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos,  La señora Virginia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar alimento balanceado para sus ganado y así de esta manera poder tener más producción de leche, La señora Virginia es una persona joven con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos ya que esta es la única actividad a la que se dedica.
texts.en: Virginia is 36 years old, married and has three children, aged 19, 17 and 15 years old respectively. Virginia makes a living buying a selling cattle and milk.  Virginia lives in Batallas, in Bolivia, and this will be her first loan with the institution. Virginia will use this loan to buy dairy cattle to raise for her business.  She is applying for the loan in order to increase her income.  The challenge Virginia is facing is to improve her business and her quality of life.  She will use her profits to buy feed for her cattle and, thus, to improve milk production.  Virginia is a young person who wants to get ahead.  She feels happy to have this opportunity to improve her business and, therefore, her income.  This is the only work that Virginia does.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
Jose tiene 42 años de edad, pero tiene el carisma de un joven de 20; cada día se levanta muy temprano para poder trabajar en su pequeño negocio de carpintería el cual ya tiene 3 años de funcionamiento y con el cual puede tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su familia sobre todo porque es padre de 2 hijos.

Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, así el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Hacer crecer su negocio”.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old but has the charisma of a young 20-year-old.  Every day he gets up very early to work at his small carpentry business.  José has had the business for three years and, with it, he can earn an income to cover household costs, which he needs particularly as he is a father to two children.

José is grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they have provided, José will be able to buy materials in order to make improvements to his home and, therefore, to improve his family's quality of life.  José will then keep fight to make his dream, of expanding his business, a reality.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 29-year-old married woman from the city of Kutaisi. She lives with her husband and little child. The only source of family income is her husband's job as an artisan. He gets private orders that monthly generate 400 GEL. Lina is unemployed at the moment and has great desire to start her own activity and do her bit for the welfare of the family. With the requested loan she wants to purchase a stock of home products at wholesale prices and then resell them among her friends and neighbors at a good price.  The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $700 for purchasing products. With support from the start-up program Lina will have an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of home products to sell

loans.name: Lernik

texts.en:
Lernik is from the Ajarkut village in the Tavushi region. He has been involved in beekeeping for many years. He also keeps chickens and 4 pigs and he cultivates plum, nut, apple, pear and other types of fruit trees. Lernik lives together with his wife and two children (ages 17 and 1 year old). 

As the only breadwinner in the family, Lernik works hard to make a good income and sustain his family's life. He is now asking for this loan to renovate the agricultural machine that helps him to organize the cultivation process. 

As this is the first loan for Lernik, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Lernik will be very grateful to lenders for their support, as the repair of his cultivator is very important for his agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of an agricultural machine.

loans.name: Omer Group

texts.en:
The Omer group consists of four ladies from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 120,000 YER, which they will use to expand their businesses. 

Shwaya is a married woman and the leader of the group. She sells clothes, incense and perfumes which she has been doing to cover the expenses of her family. She expanded her business after taking the first loan and now she is making an effort to increase her profit.

Shwaya is requesting a loan from AMB of 30,000 YER to help her to buy more clothes, incense and perfumes so as to increase her profit. All members of this group are grateful to Kiva lenders for financing their first loan.

loans.use: to help her to buy more clothes, incense and perfumes so as to increase her profit.

loans.name: Rashed

texts.en:
Rashed is a 21-year-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. His father works as an employee in a public firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.

Rashed is a student in his second year, studying Information Technology. He loves this specialization. He would like to finish his studies and find a job and help his family with part of their expenses. 

He took a 500 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan he will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily. He appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a 38-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is retail; he also sells produce and does agriculture in order to boost his income. He is facing a challenge of inadequate capital for expanding his business. However, he has a vision of buying a motorcycle for transport. Kenneth has asked for a loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Rda

texts.en:
Rda is a hardworking Iraqi client who is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. He and his eldest child provide the family income together, while the rest continue their studies.

Rda owns a workplace where he sterilizes and distributes fresh water in his neighborhood. He established his business in 2007 and has gained his experience in this field from his brother, who runs a similar business in another city. Rda is well-known in the neighborhood with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD in order to pay the annual rent on his shop and to buy a big water tank to increase his production. Rda is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide a better income for his family and take care of their needs.

loans.use: to pay annual rent on his shop and to buy a big water tank to increase his production.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 45 years old. He is married, and he has a one son. Murad is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He  is a Fuzulu refugee. 

He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10 years. He is very hardworking and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support his family. 

Murad’s income from the business is 130 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat). In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his son will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. 

He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 1,000 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue  in the coming winter, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds to grow more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay his tuition.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is 40 years old and lives with his wife and four children. He has owned a grocery store since 2005. His eldest son receives a disability pension and his three younger children are going to school. 

The house his family lives in has deteriorated, and recently he began a renovation, but due to a lack of money he stopped temporarily. Vidadi is now requesting a loan of 600 AZN to buy some materials for repairs. 

After the full renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air. Vidadi is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction work at home.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 45 years old, is married and has one daughter. She supports her family through the income she earns from making clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Yen intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy fabric, materials and sewing tools. The additional materials will enable her to increase her production for sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric, materials and sewing tools

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo, es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de familiares la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de San Felipe de Seque de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio solo hasta el nivel primaria y trabaja de ayudante de mecanico en un taller   
(reparacion de motor y otros)y recibe un jornal por dichos servicios. 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de motor y caja para su movilidad, la cual usa para transportarse a comprar repuestos y algunas veces a efectuar trabajos a domicilio de los clientes.
El sueño de Reynaldo es poder independisarse tener su propio taller asi  poder tener mejores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is single and does not have any children. He lives with relatives in a house in the area of San Felipe de Seque in the city of El Alto. 
He has only an elementary-school education. He works as a mechanic’s assistant in a garage (engine repair, etc.) and receives a daily wage for those services.
He needs this loan to buy an engine and transmission for his vehicle, which he uses for transportation to buy parts and sometimes to do work at clients’ homes.
Reynaldo’s dream is to be able to become independent and have his own garage, and therefore have a higher income and better quality of life.
This is the first time he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy an engine and transmission for his vehicle, which he uses for his job.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn is 24 years old. He is a student in his fourth year. He studies at the Technology University in Tajikistan. He lives with his parents in the capital of Tajikistan. His parents are workers. 

He wants to become the best specialist and to earn money for improving living conditions. His parents are poor people and they do not have good living conditions. Huseyn is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to pay his tuition at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay his tuition.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza was born in 1993. She is a smart woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. She is a student at the Slavonic University of Tajikistan. She is studying her third year courses, and she studies well. She always goes to the library and she reads many books. She has a lot of books. She must pay her tuition and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay her tuition.

loans.name: Yeprem

texts.en:
Yeprem lives in the village of Aghvani in the Syunik region of Armenia. He is married and has a son and a daughter. He has a specialty as a locksmith, but now he works at the factory as a driver. He also has a truck of his own and manages to haul cargo from Kapan to Yerevan and back. 

Yeprem is also engaged in farming. On his farm, he has eight cows and eight calves. His wife sells milk and other dairy products from their house. 

Yeprem wants to increase his farm cattle, since caring for the cattle is hard anyway, but the income is small. He wants to become specialized in farming and to sell a lot of meat near the Christmas holidays.

He asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams to purchase four calves and animal fodder for them.

loans.use: to purchase four calves and animal fodder for them

loans.name: Farhodjon

texts.ru: Фарходчон просит кредит, чтобы купить крупно рогатых скотов, чтобы начать бизнес животноводства. Он собирается кормить и выращивать их в коровнике. После определенных дней откорма Фарходчон продаст их на рынке родного района Шахритус. Такой деятельностью он хочет занимать много лет. Ранее он занимался продажей продуктов питания. Но сейчас у него большое желание начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Причина, по которой Фарходчон хочет начать такую деятельность является благоприятный климат и чистая природа Таджикистана. Ему не хватает часть суммы для покупки скотов. Фарходчон верит, что он сможет собрать часть недостающей суммы с Вашей помощью. Помогите ему!
texts.en: Farhodjon is requesting a loan to buy cattle and launch his animal raising business. He plans to fatten his animals, keeping them in a cowshed. After a period of fattening, Farhodjon will resell the cattle at the market of his native region Shahrituz. He plans to engage in this line of work for many years. In the past he used to sell food products. At present he has a strong wish to start a cattle business. He reasons that Tajikistan has the right climate and unpolluted natural environment. He still lacks part of the funds needed to buy cattle. Farhodjon trusts that he will be able to raise the missing amount with your help. Please help him!

loans.use: to buy cattle and launch his cattle business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, 28, is a married man. He has three (3) children, aged 17, 5 and 6 months old respectively, whom he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and he has a tailoring shop which has lasted for two years now. It is located at Mbarakachembe. In his business, he earns a monthly income of 9550 KES. He is taking his first loan of 30,000 KES, which he intends to use to add stock to his business by buying sewing thread, zips, canvas and other materials. Emmanuel will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to expand his tailoring shop and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy sewing thread, zips, canvas and other materials to make clothes for his customers.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Doña Ana es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, el cual le ha permitido seguir adelante y mantener un negocio estable. Esta agradecida con Kiva y Micrédito ya que logro comprar mercadería al por mayor e incrementar la clientela. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar pacas de ropas usadas y nuevas al por mayor, con el fin de ofertar una gran variedad de mercadería. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá surtir su mercadería e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Ana is originally from the city of Managua. She works as a vendor selling used clothing, which has allowed her to move forward and keep her business stable. She is grateful to Kiva and Micrédito because she was able to buy wholesale merchandise to increase her customer base. She is requesting a new loan to buy packs of new and used clothing wholesale so she can offer a wider variety of merchandise. She believes the loan will be a great help since she will be able to stock her merchandise and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy packs of new and used clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is mother of two children. She works at a general store as a saleswoman, and her husband is a taxi driver. They work hard to sustain the family's living and provide good living conditions for their children. 

Julieta's elder daughter is a student at Yerevan State University of Architectures and Construction. Because of the family's current costs, Julieta and her husband aren't able to save money for their daughter's education. That's the reason why Julieta has applied for this loan. It will help her to pay for the university tuition of her daughter. 

The whole family waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition of her daughter

loans.name: Narlie

texts.en:
Narlie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy needed spare parts for her tricycle. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her child. The income from her business is helping with their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain their daily needs as well as the education of their child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Narlie dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Quang

texts.en:
Quang is 56 years old and married with four children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. She runs a business of making clothes to earn a living. 

She started her business two years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of fabrics and sewing tools for making clothes. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing tools for making clothes.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 38, is married. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife works as a hired laborer. He earns an income running a store selling soft drinks in front of his house. 

He started this business three years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater quantity of beverages to stock his store and better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beverages to restock his store.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 32-year-old married man with three children. They live together in Ibb, Yemen. Rashid is happy that he received a Kiva loan that he was able to repay without much challenge. His business of vehicle repair improved after the loan and his life changed after the loan term.

He seeks another loan to expand his business further. He wants to buy tires, tubes, oil and other items necessary to run his tire shop. The challenges he faces in the business include competition. In the future, he plans to rent another shop and open a mechanic workshop. He thanks Kiva lenders for financing the first loan.

loans.use: to purchase tires, tubes, oil and other items necessary for his business.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 24 years old farmer living in the rich highlands of Kericho. She has been a farmer for 5 years and manages to produce and sell milk. She really enjoys dairy farming and you can see in her photo how happy she is with her cow.

The challenge she faces is that dairy feeds are quite expensive. Fridah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the low interest rates and easy mode of loan repayment. She learned how to develop a culture of savings, and working with a microfinance will help her boost her income. Through this loan, she will manage to store water for her farm and personal use in case there is a dry spell. Because of this her crops and livestock will flourish during seasons of dryness. This will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to be able to store water.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Doña Maura tiene 47 años de edad, madre de 6 hijos quienes dependen de ella y su esposo y en familia trabajan la tierra especializándose en la siembra y cultivo de papa ya que de este rubro dependen sus ingresos y el sustento de su familia. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora con mucha experiencia en dicha actividad ya que en su familia es una vocación y tradición siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Cuenta con un grado de educación de primaria completo gracias a la confianza, apoyo tanto financiero como moral de su madre y su padre a quienes ella agradece el esfuerzo echo en estos años de su vida. En compañía de su esposo y sus hijos se dedican a la siembra de hortalizas como ser: papa, brócoli y coliflor y el terreno que ella en compañía de su pareja de hogar trabaja es propio y está ubicado cerca de su casa de habitación a 20 metros al cual se trasladan caminando diariamente para dar asistencia a sus cultivos involucrándose su familia solamente.
Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla de papa certificada, abono, fertilizantes, foliares que darán una protección a sus cultivos de plagas y ayudaran al desarrollo y crecimiento de los mismos.
Sus sueños es dar a sus hijos una buena educación verlos crecer como personas y como profesionales ya que es lo menos que ellos se merecen. Sus metas son las de poder dar una excelente asistencia a sus cultivos de papa para obtener una buena cosecha y seguir formando y fortaleciendo poco a poco el patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maura, 47, is the mother of 6 dependent children.
