Actualmente esta señora se presento a la oficina  de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento, el que utilizaría en la Compra de camisas, pantalones, short, anillos, cadenas,  pulseras y de esta manera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora is a woman with a great desire to get ahead and to be exemplary in the community where she lives. She is a primary school teacher with 25 years' experience. She is single and doesn't have children under her care. In addition to being an educator, she has her own business selling clothes and silver jewelry, which helps improve her personal and household finances.

This woman recently came to the Ceprodel office to apply for a loan, which she will use to buy shirts, pants, shorts, rings, chains and bracelets, and in this way meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shorts, rings, chains and bracelets.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly has been running a general store for more than seven years earning well for her family. 

She used her previous loans from GDMPC to improve her business and had successfully repaid it. Recently, she requested a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. 

Merly hopes to earn more profit with her additional investments and endeavors to augment the living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Rudy Ines

texts.es: Rudy es un hombre dedicado a la enseñanza de los niños, como profesión es maestro de educación primaria con 12 años de ejercer dicha labor, actualmente se desempeña como Director de un núcleo educativo rural donde recorre 16 kilometro  diario para llegar a su  centro de trabajo ,  es casado con un hijo a quien le brinda todo el apoyo para su desarrollo académico, actualmente tiene una  necesidad  de mejorar su vivienda atravez de la construcción de cuarto, por lo que se presento a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el cual lo utilizaría en la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, bloques, zinc, perlines y pago de mano de obra, lo que le vendrá a mejorar las condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Rudy is a man who is committed to the education of children.  He is a primary school teacher who has been teaching for 12 years.  Currently, he is the director of a rural education center that is about 16 kilometers from his house.  He is married and has one son who hr supports completely in his academic development. 

Rudy is in need of making improvements to his home by building a room, which is why he approached Ceprodel for this loan that he will use to purchase construction materials such as: cement, sand, bricks, zinc, purlins and pay for labor.  This will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: purchase construction materials such as: cement, sand, bricks, zinc, purlins and pay for labor.

loans.name: Pricillah

texts.en:
Pricillah is a 41-year old-married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a viable location, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy more stock. 

Pricillah will use the 10,000 KES loan to add to her stock of maize, beans and other cereals for resale. Her business goal is to open another shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open a wholesale business. She will reinvest the anticipated profits in the business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of maize, beans and other cereals for resale

loans.name: Rhitah

texts.en:
Rhitah is married and has four children. Three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business, selling airtime and telephone booth service. She has been in this business for six years.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more airtime and phone chargers. She works at the market, six days out of every week. She sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She aspires to have a fully-stocked phone accessories shop and to own at least five pay telephones.

Rhitah resides in the family house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her biggest monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more airtime and phone chargers.

loans.name: Ibakwe Cb Group

texts.en:
Laurence is a group leader for Ibakwe, which means "courageous." All the group members have the vision of transforming their lives through the loans they wish to get. Laurence is 31 years old. She is married and has three children, between the ages of six months and five years. None of her children attend school due to the fact that they are still young. 

Laurence owns a boutique and has been running that boutique for the past six years. She has requested a loan to buy more items to add to the boutique such as fish, rice, and cooking oil for resale. With the profits from her business, she will renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more fish, rice, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Tavshut village of the Shirak region. He lives with his wife, father, and 1-year-old daughter.

He is involved in agriculture. Specifically, he keeps cows, sheep, and chickens. Armen sells his gathered harvest locally and earns an income which is vital for his family's living. 

He is asking for this loan to enlarge his agribusiness. He plans to purchase a calf and forage for feeding the livestock. 

Armen has already taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, he was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way to ensure that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Armen and his family so they can enlarge the farm and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha, a 43-year-old married mother of five, works hard to provide for her family. For the past eight years she has been running a general store in the Philippines and also earns income from buying and selling vegetables.

Having borrowed and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF, Alpha has requested a new one for PHP 13000 to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Kiem

texts.en:
Kiem, 62, is married and has six children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Kiem and her husband run a food stall, selling duck soup to people in their community. Kiem started this business 30 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying new furniture and better-quality food ingredients to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and better-quality food ingredients to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep is requesting a new loan to buy a steaming machine, hairdressing tools, and shampoos to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity, and sales. Diep hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increasing her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a steaming machine, hairdressing tools, and shampoos

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is 27 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mechanic. Hien runs a general store to earn a living. She started her business seven years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different products, such as soft drinks, to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products, such as soft drinks, to stock her store

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Demetria works hard to support her family. She has an ambulant dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from raising pigs. 

Demetria, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF, has requested  a new one for PHP 30000 to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 42-year-old, divorced woman. She lives with two sons, in Ho Chi Minh City. For 13 years, she has run a general store for people in her community.

Dung would like a loan. She will use it to purchase better-quality food products to sell to her customers, such as soy sauce, fish sauce, and household items. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.

She also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family may face.

loans.use: to purchase better quality food products, such as soy sauce and fish sauce, and household items to sell at her store

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a spice and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her spice and vegetable vending business.

Alita has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from fish/crab vending.

Alita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Chuc

texts.en: Chuc is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. Chuc hopes that her new loan will help her increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy rice in bulk to stock her store for Tet holiday selling. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. Phuong hopes that her new loan will help her increase the size of her food stall and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more rice to stock her store for Tet holiday selling

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en: Dieu is requesting a new loan to buy a refrigerator, new furniture, and a stand umbrella. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. Dieu hopes that his new loan will help him increase the size of his food stall and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, new furniture, and a stand umbrella

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue is requesting another loan, which she will use to buy soft drinks, coffee, and sugar and a computer for her children. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers and to better educate her children. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and sales and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, coffee, and sugar and purchase a computer for her children' education

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Isata from Waterloo2 western rural area in Freetown. She is single and has three children between the ages of 2 and 18 years.  In 2007, Isata established a wood business. She began her business because she wanted to develop her family. She works at the business from 8:00 am to 5:30 pm, seven days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Isata requires a loan in order to purchase more wood for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Isata plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for resale.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Mabinty from rural Waterloo in western Freetown. She is married with six children.

In 2006 Mabinty began selling cola nuts and other general stock with the aim of improving her family’s welfare. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. seven days a week. A lack of money to expand her business is her main challenge.

Mabinty is applying for a 900,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more cola nuts and other stock to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business.

Mabinty hopes to continue expanding her business in the years ahead. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cola nuts and other stock to sell.

loans.name: Jamolidin

texts.ru:
Чамолидин житель городка Вахдат. Ему 40 лет. Он счастливый муж и отец пятерых детей. Его дети маленькие и еще ходят в школу, поэтому его жена не работает и сидит дома присматривает за детьми. Семью кормит Чамолидин. Он зарабатывает путем предоставления услуги такси. Этой деятельностью он занимается около трех лет. Чамолидину нравится его работа. Он помогает людям добираться с одной точки города до другой. У него появились постоянные клиенты. Чамолидин очень вежливый и дружелюбный таксист. Он очень счастлив, что ему начинают звонить по телефону, чтобы сделать заказ. 
 Чамолидин хочет, чтобы его пассажирам было удобно, комфортно и чтоб они быстрее добирались до места назначения. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. Он хочет поменять свою машину. Он продаст свою старую машину и сумму от продажи добавит на сумму от кредита и купит новую машину.
texts.en:
Jamolidin is a resident of the town of Vahdat. He is 40 years old. He is a happy husband and the father of five children. His children are small and still don't go to school, and therefore his wife does not work. She stays at home and looks after the children. 

Jamolidin provides for his family. He earns money through providing a taxi service. He has worked with this business for around three years. Jamolidin likes his work. He helps people to get from one place in the city to another. He was able to attract regular customers. Jamolidin is a very polite and friendly taxi driver. He is very happy that people have started to phone him to place orders. 

Jamolidin would like his passengers to be comfortable and get to their destination even faster. With this aim he applied for a loan. He would like to change his car. He will sell his old car and add this to the loan amount to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car in order to provide a taxi service

loans.name: Dilangez

texts.ru:
Дилангез любимая жена и молодая мама. Ей 21 год. Дилангез замужем и в браке у нее есть ребенок. Ее мальчику 1 год. Дилангез работает продавщицей в ювелирном магазине. Магазин находится в центральном рынке района. Дилангез любит свою работу. Ее всегда поддерживает ее муж. В ювелирном магазине Дилангез занимается продажей золота, серебра и других ювелирных изделий из драгоценных металлов. 
    Дилангез заинтересована на счет расширения своей деятельности, и она решила взять кредит и купить несколько ювелирных изделия для перепродажи в ее магазине. Дилангез нравится работать в этой сфере деятельности, и она верит, что вы ей поможете расширить ассортимент ее товаров.
texts.en:
Dilangez is a loving wife and a young mother. She is 21 years old. Dilangez is married and she has one child, her son who is one year old. Dilangez works with sales at a jewelry store. The store is at the central market of the region. Dilangez loves her work. Her husband always supports her. At the jewelry store, Dilangez sells gold, silver and other jewelry made from precious metals. 

Dilangez is interested in expanding her business, and she decided to take a loan and purchase some jewelry to sell at her store. Dilangez likes to work with this type of business and she believes that you will help her expand her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry for reselling

loans.name: Yunus

texts.ru:
Юнус является животноводом и мясником, живет в городе Исфара, ему 35 лет. Юнус во дворе своего дома разводит лошадь и крупнорогатый скот. Сейчас в его хозяйстве имеется только одна лошадь американской породы. Юнус занимается куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота в течение 10 лет. Ему помогает жена. Это их семейный бизнес и их бизнес выглядит таким образом. Юнус обычно закупает скот с местного скотного рынка, затем он вместе с женой откармливает их в течение месяца и после этого Юнус продает мясо коров в местные столовые и рестораны. 
У Юнуса трое детей. Сыновьям по 9 и 3 года, а дочери 8 лет. Юнус их очень любит и гордится ими. Он всегда работает усердно, чтобы его дети ни в чем не нуждались. Так как дети растут, расходы семьи тоже увеличиваются. Юнус планирует расширить бизнес и поэтому просит кредит для купли пару голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Yunus is a livestock breeder and a butcher. He lives in the city of Isfara. He is 35 years old. Yunus breeds horses and cattle in the yard of his house. Currently he only has one horse, of American breed, in his yard. 

Yunus has been engaged in cattle sales for a period of 10 years. His wife helps him. This is their family business and it works like this: Yunus usually purchases cattle at the local cattle market. Then he and his wife fatten them for a period of a month. After this, Yunus sells the cow meat to local cafeterias and restaurants. 

Yunus has three children. His sons are 9 and 3 years, and his daughter is 8. Yunus loves them very much and are proud of them. He always works diligently in order for his children to have everything they need. As the children grow, the family's expenses also increase. Yunus plans to expand his business and therefore requests a loan to purchase two heads of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase two heads of cattle

loans.name: Nelis  Batania

texts.es: Nelis  es maestra de educación primaria de un núcleo educativo del sector donde habita, con 10 años de ejercer  dicha actividad, es casada, con un hijo a su cargo. Actualmente tiene la necesidad de seguir mejorando su vivienda a través de la construcción de un cuarto, la que con mucho sacrificio ha venido realizando , por eso visito la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento el que lo utilizaría en Compra de materiales de construcción, hierro, arena, cemento, ladrillas, piedrín, zinc y mano de obra y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Nelis is a primary school teacher in an educational center in the area she lives in; she has taught for 10 years.  She is married and has one son.  

She is currently in need of making improvements to her home by building a room, which through much sacrifice she has begin to make it happen.  For this reason, she visited the Ceprodel office to request a loan to purchase construction materials such as: iron, sand, cement, bricks, stone, zinc and pay for labor, which will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: purchase construction materials such as: iron, sand, cement, bricks, stones, zinc and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 38-years-old and widowed with five children.

Lita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of recycled materials to sell.

Lita has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling business of recycled materials for two years and also earns an income from a general store.

Lita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like wood, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Gene has been in this business for ten years. Gene earns more income from food vending.

Gene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like wood, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 58 years old and married with 3 children.

Encarnacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, etc.

Encarnacion has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from farming rice.

Encarnacion aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Banco Mujer La Amistad Group

texts.es: Priscilla es integrante de Banco Mujer La Amistad, una mujer muy joven con apenas 21, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos, uno niño de 3 años, y otros que tiene poco menos de un mes de nacido. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y valiente, desde siempre ha trabajado para ayudar a su compañero con los gastos del hogar. Sabe lo que es levantarse muy temprano para hacer todas sus labores domesticas, cuidar de sus niños, dedicarle tiempo a su actividad productiva que es el desarrollo y engorde de cerdos, y como si fuera poco por las noches terminar sus estudios de secundaria que concluyo recientemente. Este es su día a día, con un pequeño negocio que se ha consolidado gracias a los 3 financiamientos que ha recibido por parte de Fundación Mujer. Está nueva inversión será para la compra de cerdos, y una cerda de cría, alimentos y algunos materiales para mejorar en encierro de los cerdos.  Sus metas a futuro es aumentar su patrimonio y producción de su actividad, mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia ya que su esposo no tiene un trabajo fijo, y luego seguir estudiando. Junto a Priscilla están 3 socias mas que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Priscilla is a member of Banco Mujer La Amistad [Woman Friendship Bank]. She is a young woman, just over 21 years old. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children – a three-year-old boy and a newborn who is just under a month old. Priscilla is very enterprising and courageous, and she has always worked to help her partner with household expenses. She knows what it’s like to get up very early to do household work, look after her children and make time for her business, which is raising and fattening pigs. And if that weren’t enough, in the evenings she has been studying for her high school degree, which she recently completed. This is her day-to-day life, with a small business that has grown stronger thanks to three loans she has received from Fundación Mujer.

Priscilla is requesting this new loan to buy hogs, a sow, feed and some materials for improving her pigpen. Her goals for the future are to increase the production of her business and her assets, as well as to improve her family’s economic situation, since her husband does not have steady work. She would also like to continue studying.

Along with Priscilla, there are three other members of the group, who plan to start agricultural and livestock businesses.

loans.use: to buy hogs, a sow, feed and some materials for improving her pigpen.

loans.name: Mauricio  José

texts.es: Mauricio se desempeña como maestro de educación primaria, en el área de multigrado en un colegio del departamento de león, con ocho años de laborar, es soltero , no tiene hijos, actualmente tiene la necesidad de realizar mejoras en su vivienda la que está  en mal estado, por tal razón se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y realizar la obra deseada, ya que el mismo lo  utilizaría en la compra de puertas, cemento, arena y ladrillos, el que le vendría a dar mejores condiciones a su hogar.
texts.en:
Mauricio works as a primary school teacher in a multi-grade school in the county of León.  He has been a teacher for 8 years, is single and does not have any children.  

He is currently in need of making some repairs to his home as it is in bad shape.  For this reason, he went to the Ceprodel office to request a loan to allow him to perform the necessary work.  He will use the loan to purchase doors, cement, sand and bricks, which will allow him to improve his housing conditions.

loans.use: purchase doors, cement, sand and bricks.

loans.name: Maryuri Yissell

texts.es: Maryuri, es una señora emprendedora de profesión maestra de educación secundaria, también ejerce la actividad comercial como es la venta de ropa y calzado, es casada con tres personas a su cargo. También su esposa ejerce la actividad de venta el servicio de transporte, esta señora tiene la necesidad de incrementar su inventario y de aprovechar la oportunidad de negocio por eso visito la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el cual lo utilizara en la Compra de  faldas, blusas, zapatas y sandalias para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes,  lo que le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maryuri is an enterprising, secondary school teacher who also works selling clothing and shoes.  She is married and has three dependents.  Her spouse also works in transportation services.  

Maryuri is in need of increasing her inventory and taking advantage of business, which is why she visited the Ceprodel office to request a loan.  She will use this loan to purchase  skirts, blouses, shoes and sandals to meet her customers' demand, which in turn will allow her to improve her conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: purchase skirts, blouses, shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Karei

texts.en:
Karei is 65 years old, married to Esther, and a father of seven children aged between 10 and 27 years old. He has been a livestock farmer in the outskirts of Narok for the last ten years. Karei earns an approximate income of about 15,000 KES in a month.

Karei is currently obtaining his second loan of 40,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya that will facilitate his plans to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale. He learned about VisionFund Kenya from one of the long-serving clients of the organization. 

He intends to use the anticipated profits to add to his herd and to pay school fees for his kids. Karei's dream is to prosper and improve the family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Mukoitha

texts.en:
Mukoitha is a 58-year-old married woman. She has 8 children with ages ranging from 14 years to 38 years. She describes herself as a social person. 

She operates a retail business where she sells household goods such as rice, sugar, drinks, tea leaves, maize flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located in an area with availability of customers and her primary customers are local residents. 

Mukoitha describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital to expand business. She will use the 60,000 KES loan to add stock of rice, sugar, tea leaves, maize flour, and other items to her shop. 

Mukoitha's business goal is to open a wholesale store and two other branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, all her children will attain good education. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 70,000 KES was repaid successfully. Mukoitha will use the anticipated profits to buy food for her family, pay the loan, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to add stock of rice, sugar, tea leaves, maize flour, and other items to her shop.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards, enabled her to expand her business,  and earned her a higher income.

Besides the charcoal selling business, Emma operates a shop kiosk.

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase eggs, sugar, sweets, and cooking oil for resale. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, sugar, sweets, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is 38 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a electrician. She has been running a business selling electrical items from in front of her house for the past seven years.

Linh obtained a previous loan through CEP that enabled her to expand her business and earn more money to support her family. She is now requesting a 20,000,000 VND loan to continue improving her business by buying a variety of electrical goods from different suppliers to meet customer demand.

Linh hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and raise her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of electrical goods from different suppliers

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao is requesting a new loan to purchase tires for her family's vehicle to replace the old ones. This purchase will help her family transport goods. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her family's vehicle.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en: Chau is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying a variety of different sanitary papers and plastic boxes to stock her store. Chau's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. Chau also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different sanitary papers and plastic boxes to stock her store.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is requesting a new loan to buy a quantity of clothes for selling and a motorcycle for transportation. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing her income, expanding her business and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling and a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil, dried fish, and dried meat for her business

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang is a 56-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her two children. For ten years she has operated a cafe and soft-drink stall in front of her house.

Hoang would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and to attract additional customers. 

Hoang also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo2 Western rural in Freetown. She is married and has 3 children, one of whom is currently attending school. In 2010, Salamatu established her food stand business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business 7 days per week. Salamatu says that her main business challenge is transportation problems within her area.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice and seasonings for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her life and increase her business. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Wendy  Rosario

texts.es: Wendy es una joven señora, preocupada por la salud de los demás, ya que por vocación de servicio su profesión es auxiliar de enfermería, con 2 años  de ejercer dicha profesión, es madre de un hijo al que apoya en su desarrollo, vive en un unión libre con su marido, actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por tal razón se acerco a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento, el que utilizaría en la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena , cemento, zinc, perlines y mano de obra, `para la construcción de un cuarto el que le vendría a  dar mejores condiciones a su hogar.
texts.en:
Wendy is a young women who is concerned about the health of others, as she has worked as a nursing assistant for the past two years.  She is the mother of one son who she supports in his development.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her husband.  

She is currently in need of repairing her home, which is why she approached the Ceprodel office to request a loan.  She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as: blocks, sand, cement, zinc, purlins and pay for labor to build a room that will improve her housing conditions.

loans.use: purchase construction materials such as: blocks, sand, cement, zinc, purlins and pay for labor.

loans.name: Estevao

texts.pt:
O Estevão é Casado maritalmente e pai de 5 (cinco) filhos e vive também com mais duas pessoas na sua responsabilidade. Ele trabalha num Restaurante Beach Bar como Servente de Mesa e tem um pequeno negócio na sua casa para reforçar a sua fonte de receita.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade (: 24kg de açúcar, uma caixa de sabão, 12cx de vinagre, 50kg de arroz, 50kg de amendoim 5 caixas de refresco).
Seu maior sonho e ter uma casa na sua terra natal Inhambane
O seu maior desafio é fortificar o seu negócio para que possa garantir o seu sustento e futuramente adquirir  UMA VIATURA 4X4 porque vive numa zona arenosa.
texts.en:
Estevão is married, the father of 5 (five) children and also lives with two more people who he is responsible for. He works at a Restaurant Beach Bar as a waiter and has a small business which he runs from home to reinforce his income.

With this loan he plans to buy basic products (24kg of sugar, a box of soap, 12 boxes of vinagre, 50kg of rice, 50kg of peanuts and 5 boxes of sodas).

His biggest dream is to have a house in his hometown of Inhambane.
His biggest challenge is to strengthen his business to be able to guarantee his livelihood and in the future to buy a 4x4 vehicle, because he lives in a sandy area.

loans.use: buy basic products (24kg of sugar, a box of soap, 12 boxes of vinagre, 50kg of rice, 50kg of peanuts and 5 boxes of sodas) for resale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales; ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche del departamento de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

Ella vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector. El crédito será utilizado en la compra de un par de vacas lecheras de raza mejorada para obtener una mejor leche.

El sueño de Julia y su familia  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Julia, along with a group of people from the same community, decided to take care of the earth and the animals. She makes her living raising cattle for the production of milk, which she sells to one of the milk processing plants in the province of La Paz. The first step she took was to not tie up the cows, nor to keep them enclosed far away from the fields where they like to graze, nor cut off their horns so that they will produce calves in a natural way. The feed that she gives them is fresh and of great quality to conserve the good health of her cows.

She lives in the house of her parents, located in the community of Pallina Chico, Viacha sector, Ingavi province, La Paz province. It is one hour away from the city of La Paz. She has various heads of creole cattle, which require better care given the climactic conditions of the sector.

The loan will be used to purchase a pair of milk cows of a better species to obtain better milk. Julia and her family's dream is to increase their heads of cattle and care for their good health. This is the first time she has applied for a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of cows of a better species to obtain better quality milk.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.pt:
O Leonardo vive na casa própria, Casado maritalmente e Pai de três filhos. Ele trabalha como transportador há mais de três anos.
Com o valor a ser financiado pretende comprar: 2 pneus e uma bateria para sua viatura de marca Isuzu
O seu maior sonho é terminar a sua obra tipo 3 que encontra se na cidade para poder arrendar e aumentar a fonte de rendimento.
O seu maior desafio é abrir um furo de água na sua casa da ponta de ouro e concluir a mesma.
texts.en:
Leonardo lives in a house he owns, is married and is the father of three children. He has worked in transport for more than 3 years.

With this loan he plans to buy: 2 tires and one battery for his Isuzu brand vehicle.

His biggest dream is to finish building his 3 bedroom house in the city so that he can rent it out and increase his income.
His biggest challenge is to open a water borehole at his house in Ponta de Ouro and to finish building it.

loans.use: pretende comprar: 2 pneus e uma bateria para sua viatura de marca Isuzu

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadora de Leche de La Paz.
Ella vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar forraje para  la alimentacion del ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El sueño de Maribel es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maribel raises cattle for their milk which she sells to one of the industrialized milk plants in La Paz.

She lives in her parents' house an hour distant from the city of La Paz, in the community of Pallina Chico, the Viacha Sector of Ingavi Province, La Paz Department.

The loan she desires is for purchasing forage to feed her cattle, in order to improve their production and conserve their good health.

Maribel's dream is to increase the number of her cattle, taking precautions for their health.

This is Maribel's 1st loan request through IMPRO and, also, her 1st loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy forage for her milk cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Juntas Emprendiendo Futuro Group

texts.es: Rosa, quien está en medio arriba en la fotografía, con una polera celeste pelo negro  peinado hacia atrás y saludando con sus dedos a la cámara, es socia del Banco Comunal Juntas Emprendiendo Futuro de Cañete ubicada en la provincia de Arauco región del Bío Bío. Los socios de este Banco Comunal tienen variados rubros tales como la venta de mariscos, chocolatería artesanal, artesanía en madera, tejido y joyería de plata. El negocio de Rosa es la artesanía en madera, que la aprendió de su marido hace ya 17 años, en la cual tiene participando también a sus hijos. Su mayor desafío es poder llevar fuera de su comuna su hermosa artesanía, pero para eso debe poder comprar maquinaria que le hace falta para fabricar otras artesanías, ya que su marido las vendió, es por esto que está solicitando dinero, para poder comprarlas, además de comprar madera, spray para pintar y barniz. Le ha ido bien, está contenta con sus ventas pero depende mucho de la compa de las maquinas para ampliar su artesanía y qua así le vaya mucho mejor con las ventas. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que ayuda a las personas además de con dinero de poder empoderarlas y ayudarles a subir su autoestima.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is in the top center of the photograph, wearing a polo shirt, black hair combed back and raising her fingers to the camera, is a member of the “Juntas Emprendiendo Futuro de Cañete” communal bank, located in the Arauco province in the Bio Bio region.  The members have different businesses they work in, such as selling seafood, artistic chocolates, wooden arts and crafts, knitting, and silver jewelry.

Rosa is an artist and learned from her husband 17 years ago and her children also help.  Her biggest challenge is taking her lovely art out of her community, but she needs to buy a machine that she needs to make more works of art, since her husband sold the others.  She is asking for a loan to be able to buy it, as well as lumber, spray paint, and varnish.

Things have gone well for her and she is happy about her sales but she is dependent on the machine so she can expand her arts and things will go much better with her sales.  The thing she has liked best about working with Fondo Esperanza is the fact that is helps people and empowers them to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Анвару из города Турсунзаде 35 лет. Он женат и имеет детей. Его дети маленькие и его жена сидит дома и присматривает за детьми. Жена Анвара умеет шить и пользуясь своим умением на ровне с мужем берет заказы на шитье дома. 
  Анвар работает таксистом. Он уже много лет предоставляет жителям города Турсунзаде услугу такси. У Анвара нет высшего образования и услуга такси на сегодняшний день для него единственный заработок. 
   Машина Анвара сломалась и на данный момент он не работает. Анвар остро нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить автозапчасти и починить машину. Анвар очень надеется, что он получит финансирование, и он скорее вернется к работе.
texts.en:
Anvar is from the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 35 years old, married, and has children. His children are small and his wife stays at home to look after them. Anvar's wife knows how to sew and uses her knowledge, just like her husband. She takes order for sewing at home. 

Anvar works as a taxi driver. He has provided a taxi service for the people of Tursun-zoda for many years. Anvar does not have higher education and currently the taxi service is his only income. Anvar's car broke down and currently he does not work. Anvar acutely needs a loan to purchase spare parts for repairing his car. He hopes that he will receive financing and that he soon can return to work.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Marga Indah Ternak Group

texts.en: Becoming one of the sources of family income, Ni Komang continues her loan to increase the pig business. With full support from her husband, Ni Komang will use her loan to purchase superior feed and also some chili seeds for her garden. The rainy season is the right time to plant chili and other crops. She hopes all the planning goes well and she earns a satisfactory profit. All she wants is to become a piglet seller and also have many cows. Two of the members couldn't attend the meeting because they had a ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: To purchase superior feed and also some chili seeds for her garden.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 50, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a general store in front of their house for ten years. Yen is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more products, such as washing powder and different household items, to better satisfy her customers.

Yen hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more products, such as washing powder and different household items, to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet, 52 years old, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a general store and a cafe for twenty years. 

Nguyet intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different products to stock her general store and coffee to sell to her customers. Nguyet hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products to stock her general store and coffee to sell in her cafe

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le, 40, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a mason. Le supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business nineteen years ago. Le sells toothpaste, snack foods, shampoo and other household items to people in her community. 

Le is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and household items, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and setting aside some money for facing future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products to stock her store and better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sodas, dairy products, cold cuts, pastries, chicken, and meats.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Irene works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Irene is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like spices, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc. for her general store business.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like spices, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 33-years-old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Criselda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Criselda has been farming rice  for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace un año que ella estableció su propio negocio de un salón de belleza, donde hace cortes de pelo, planchados, secado, pedicure, manicure, uñas acrílicas, etc. el negocio lo tiene en un local que alquila en el mercado local. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 14,000 Lempiras, para comprar una silla para mejorar el salón y brindar mejor servicio, también comprara tintes, tratamientos para cabello, unas, esmaltes y otros productos de belleza que necesite.  En el futuro tiene como meta la apertura de otro salón para obtener mas ingresos y que sus hijos tengan un respaldo económico para su futuro.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 26-year-old single mother of two children and lives in the town of San Pedro Sula. She started her own business a year ago, opening a beauty salon at a site she rents in a local market. Rosa cuts, straightens, and dries hair; and provides manicures, pedicures, acrylic nails, and other services. 

Rosa is applying for a loan of 14,000 Lempiras to purchase a chair that will improve her salon and allow her to provide better service. She will also purchase hair dyes and treatments, nails, nail polish, and other beauty products that she needs to serve her customers. One of Rosa's goals is to open another salon in the future so she can earn higher income and ensure her children's future financial support.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, acrylic nails, nail polish, treatments, and other products as well as a chair for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Isidora Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Isidora, tiene 56 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad. El marido es chofer. 
Doña Isidora es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para tener sus propios ingresos por el bien de sus familia, es por eso que hace cinco años decidió arrendar un local en el centro de la ciudad  y poner un pequeño mini bazar  el cual le está dando muy buenas satisfacciones, ella utilizo lo que recibió en uno de los créditos para empezar y luego y gracias a los créditos lo ha ido surtiendo, allí vende ropa, zapatos, bisutería y muchos artículos más para regalos así como también recargas telefónicas y helados, trabaja todos los días sola.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa que es lo que más vende en esta época. Está desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los  créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que los arriendos se le llevan gran parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” lending group meets every two weeks in the “24 de Mayo” settlement in the Manabi province, known for its forests, variety of fauna, and for its friendly and hardworking people dedicated to farming and raising livestock.

Isidora lives here.  She is 56 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has five adult children.  Her husband works as a driver.

Isodora is a lady who likes to work to have her own income for the good of her family, so she rented a location in the city center and set up a small shop and it has been very satisfying.  She used her earnings and a loan to start and then, thanks to some loans, she has been stocking it.  She sells clothing, shoes, costume jewelry, and many other gift items and also cell phone cards and ice cream every day.

She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, which is what she sells most of over this season.  She has been with the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans.  Her dream is to have her own shop because the rent eats up a large part of her earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales; ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

Ella vive en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector. El préstamo lo requiere para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para incrementar su producción de leche y por consiguiente sus ingresos.

El sueño de Maribel y su familia  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maribel is part of a group of people from her community who decided to work the land and raise animals. She works raising cows to produce milk, which she sells to one of the milk processing plants in La Paz. The first decision Maribel made was not to tie up her cows, nor to keep them fenced in far from the pastures where they like to graze. She also did not cut their horns. She wanted her cows to calve naturally, to eat fresh, high-quality feed and to be healthy.

Maribel lives in her in-laws’ house, which is in the community of Pallino Chico, in the municipality of Viacha, province of Ingavi and department of La Paz. Pallina Chico is one hour from the city of La Paz. She has a number of head of cattle of the “Criollo” breed, which she says require better care because of the climate in her area.

Maribel is requesting this loan to buy a couple of dairy cattle to increase her milk production and therefore her income. She and her family dream of increasing the number of head of cattle they have and ensuring that their cattle are in good health. This is Maribel’s first loan with IMPRO and her first loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a couple of dairy cattle to increase her milk production.

loans.name: Glory Dewata Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Ni Wayan and the other members of the Glory Dewata group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Wayan hopes that through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  

Ni Wayan will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months of fattening.  With her profits, she will help support her family of two by supplementing the income. Her husband works as a farmer. Ultimately, Ni Wayan hopes that the increased income will enable her to pay school fees and also for future needs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Gulamali

texts.ru:
Гуламали 38 летний житель Турсунзаде. Он гордо носит статус верного мужа и отца. Гуламали как отец должен обеспечить своих детей жильем, едой и образованием. Гуламали старается обеспечить своих детей и жену, чтоб они не в чем не нуждались. Гуламали зарабатывает путем предоставления услуги такси. Более 10 лет он возит людей по их маршруту. Таким способом он кормит свою семью. 
  Сейчас Гуламали не работает. Потому что его машина не пригодна для работы. Чтобы починить машину, у него нет достаточной суммы денег. Гуламали обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить не обходимые запчасти, отремонтировать свою машину и приступить к работе.
texts.en:
Gulamali is a 38 year old resident of Tursun-zoda. He proudly holds the status of a faithful husband and father. As a father, Gulamali needs to provide a house, food and education for his children. Gulamali tries to provide for his children and wife so that they are not in need of anything. 

Gulamali earns money through providing a taxi service. He has driven people for more than 10 years, and feeds his family this way. Currently, Gulamali does not work, because his car is not suitable for driving. He does not have enough money for repairing his car. 

Gulamali takes a loan to purchase necessary spare parts to repair his car and return to work.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She also sells ready-to-wear products for additional income.

Milagros dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Etrudes Dolores

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Etrudes, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y fruto de relación tiene un hijo de 19 años que estudia en Universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.
Ella se dedica al comercio tiene un pequeño bar en donde vende bebidas como: gaseosas, aguas, cervezas y batidos de frutas, también prepara y vende empanadas, hamburguesas, entre otros bocadillos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00,  lleva 17 años dedicada a su negocio y  le va muy bien y además se entretiene  en el.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar: gaseosas, bebidas energizantes, aguas, cervezas, pan y víveres. Es socia del Grupo de Crédito desde hace ya varios años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” lending group meets every two weeks in the “24 de Mayo” settlement in the Manabi province, known for its forests, variety of fauna, and for its friendly and hardworking people dedicated to farming and raising livestock.

Etrudes lives here.  She is 57 years old, married, and has a 19 year old son who attends university.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is also a merchant and has a small pub where she sells beverages like soft drinks, flavored waters, beers, and mixed drinks.  The works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm and has been doing this for 17 years.  Things are going well for her and she also finds it entertaining.

She will use the money from this loan to buy soft drinks, energy drinks, flavored waters, beers, bread, and food.  She has been with the credit group for several years and she likes the help she gets through loans.  Her dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is a 50-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past 10 years, Van and her husband have run a metal processing business.

Van would like a loan to purchase better quality tools and equipment for processing metal. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. Van also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality tools and equipment for processing metal

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is a 37-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. For the past 10 years, Hong and her husband have earned a living running a general store. Hong would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. Hong also hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en: Tuyen is requesting a new loan to buy more new furniture and better quality food, that will increase the capacity of her business. Tuyen's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more new furniture and better quality food

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with seven children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past four years, she has been selling cows and goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan of  50,000 KES to purchase cows and goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cows and goats for her business.
